title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very conversational and friendly. Recruiter was very insightful and supportive. They shared a considerable amount of information and was open and transparent. It was a search that had been going on for some time. Understandably, the institution was most interested in religous affiliation and mission-driven motivations.
Interview Questions: Given the faith-based environment, can you share what draws you to this type of institution?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lipscomb University
Interview Descriptions: At first: Phone call, then in person interview and last homework. Received offer a few weeks later. Then reference check and background check. Everything took about three months before first day of work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What is a difficulty you experienced in your job?

title: College Admissions Recruiter Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was multi-faceted and included an initial phone screening, an in-person interview, a presentation in front of a group.  Nothing out of the ordinary for this type of role.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to this position that makes you uniquely qualified for a role like this?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They were very detailed in making sure you were locked in to the research study. Just want to make sure you are ready for the challenge. It was a formal interview so suit and tie would be ideal to help you get the job.
Interview Questions: What is your driving force for wanting to do research?

title: Director Advertising Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lipscomb University in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: pretty straight forward, interviewed with hiring manager on the phone and then with them in person on campus.  I had applied online.  Interviewing with the group was pretty laid back, but I didn't have any information who was going to be on the panel beforehand so I could prepare.
Interview Questions: If your personality was a color what would it be?

title: Housing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel style interview, casual and fun interview.  The process took nearly 2 months with no timeline as to interview process.  Overall lack of organization and communication with applicants.
Interview Questions: How individual faith walk is relevant in day to day life.

title: Chemistry Lab Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Lipscomb University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process depends on your title and what job you are looking for. You will be interviewed by the Head of the department that you want to work for.
Interview Questions:
Why Lipscomb? 
What times are you available to be in laboratories?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty informal and few difficult questions were asked. None of the typical interview questions were asked. Once interview concluded it only took about 1-2 weeks to receive an email from HR.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lipscomb University
Interview Descriptions: A few days after I submitted my application I got an email asking me to pick a phone interview time. The day of the phone interview I was emailed by the hiring manager to make sure that the time was still good for me. The actual phone call lasted about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Lipscomb?

title: Assistant Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by both my direct program manager as well as the Dean and Associate Dean.  The interview process consisted of two interviews on separate days. I was asked to verify my teaching experience and qualifications.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy of Education?

title: Adjunct Faculty - Education Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, must get foot in the door to move up in the University, interview was very casual, get to know you type interview.  Paperwork was easy to complete.  Interview lasted about an hour, two people on the panel.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3-part formal interview with 3 individuals who worked in the department. Many of the interview questions were repeated by each person doing the interviewing. After the interview, I was asked back to have coffee with the same people. I was offered the job a day later and accepted it shortly after.
Interview Questions: What strengths would you bring to the job?

title: Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lipscomb University
Interview Descriptions: I knew the director at the same of application so my process went more swiftly than normal. I was asked for an interview over the phone and then a week later in person to discuss personality traits and how to handle working in a Christian school and acting as a role model.
Interview Questions: Would you be excited to come to work here and why?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I had two official interviews: one with the head of the department and one with the dean of the college.  Both were casual and low-stress.  The interviews centered around past job experience, pedagogical strategies for instructing reading and composition, and university culture.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult student in the classroom? Do you have any experience working with ESL students in the general composition classroom?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straightforward- I submitted an application and resume, then spoke over the phone with the hiring manager. Two weeks later, I met with a hiring committee and then three weeks later, I was offered the job during a one-on-one meeting on campus. I knew several people in the specific department that I had applied to, and got an interview on the strength of those recommendations.
Interview Questions: I don't know that I would say that there were any hard questions- it was a pretty simple interview process and I had an immediate report with the hiring manager.

title: Event Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick interview.  Just asked basic AV questions then told me i had the job.  You really dont have to worry about the interview . They test you once you get to work not in the interview.
Interview Questions: What event experience do you have

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor, Physics Or Science Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I have not to present had any hiring interviews with this employer.

title: Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Not a very in depth interview.  Read over my resume and after reading offered me the job.

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lipscomb University (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: You sit in a room with two recruiters and then switch to another room with two recruiters. They are very kind and chat with you about your resume. They care a lot about how open your schedule is and that affects which role you get. If you want to be a tour guide, you must have great people skills and be able to sell why you love Lipscomb.
